results.title: Nightride
results.creator_credit: Martin Murphy, Della Churchill and AFTRS
results.brief_description: A boy travelling on a night bus is witness to the murders of other passengers, by a masked killer. “Nightride” condenses the conventions of a horror film into 11 minutes, climaxing with a terrifying confrontation between the boy and the killer. This excellent Australian student short has won numerous international and national film festival awards.

results.title: Nightlife
results.brief_description: Robin Lehman explores the wonders of the cold seas of Ireland. Shows the many creatures and plants, including scallops, sea anemone, fan worm and jellyfish. This fantastic drama captures some of nature’s most amazing and improbable creations. Without words but accompanied by music and sound effects.

results.title: Night driving
results.creator_credit: John Edwards, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “How to Drive”.
If your vision is normal and the lighting equipment of your car is in efficient working order, there is nothing to be scared of in night driving. The same section of road from a driver’s viewpoint is shown by day and by night, pointing out the different methods of detecting various features which will affect course and speed in night driving.

results.title: Nigeria 1960 - sunrise in the east
results.creator_credit: Eric Chamberlain, Andre Libik, Victor M. Gover and British Information Services
results.brief_description: A survey of eastern Nigeria against a background of Independence celebrations: the region and its people, natural resources and recent developments in industry, agriculture, transport, communications, health and education services.

results.title: Nicholas and Alexandra
results.creator_credit: Armorer Wason, Michael Beckham, Granada International Productions and Granite Film
results.brief_description: For over 70 years the story of Russia’s last Tsar, Nicholas II and his Empress, Alexandra has exercised a poignant magic. Presented by His Royal Highness Prince Michael of Kent, this documentary delves into the imperial archives held in Moscow and St Petersberg, once sealed by the Secret Police and forbidden to all but a handful of curators. The archives reveal intimate diaries and letters of the Romanovs, their photograph albums, records of state visits and political intrigue.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Armorer Wason, Michael Beckham, Granada International Productions and Granite Film

results.title: Nicaragua no pasaran
results.brief_description: An award-winning documentary that focuses on the guerrilla leader, political fugitive and revolutionary hero, Tomas Borge. Borge, the only surviving member of the original Sandinista movement, is Minister of the Interior in the nine man National Directorate, the collective leadership that governs Nicaragua. He recounts his experiences during his internment under the US-backed Somoza dictatorship. Explains the events which led to the formation of the revolutionary Sandinista movement and its rise to power in 1979. Also explores accusations made by Ronald Reagan that the Sandinista government is involved in activities that threaten to destabilise Central America. Contains b&w sequences. Photography by Geoffrey Simpson.

results.title: Nicaragua
results.creator_credit: Alan Lowery and Central Independent Television (UK)
results.brief_description: John Pilger presents a documentary impression with interviews of Nicaraguan society under the present Sandinista Government; relates a brief history of the events of this century; and returns to protest against American intervention. The film makes no secret of its admiration for Sandinista reforms and its abhorrence of American policy.

results.title: Niagara for sale
results.brief_description: Niagara Peninsula is a fertile strip of land that produces most of Canada’s fruit supply, however the factors that make it a productive farming area also attracts industry and developers who cover the land with cement. This film presents the views of farmers, developers, scientists and politicians on the competition for natural resources.

results.title: Niagara Falls: beauty and power
results.brief_description: Shows the scenic beauty and the economic importance of the falls as a source of hydroelectric power. Opening sequence gives the geological explanation of the formation of the falls and tells of the discovery of the falls and their early history.
